column4: Ok can I PLEASE get some help running World of Warcraft on Ubuntu!?
I had it running under 7.04 but now I can't do it at all, it just gives me an error message
hmm and did world of warcraft install ok
It installed great, updated itself which surprised me before it didn't, but now it wont open at all
I can't edit the config file to make it opengl all the time but I add the command but I can't get it to open at all and I do not want Windows and I do not want to cancel wow
there is a little problem in wine it does not select the default working directory in some cases
try running it from the terminal but change to the installed directory first

Well, do you play WoW? It opens it's little window, it shows me the news about wow and everything, then I hit play, and it goes to load it,..... I wait for up to 10 minnutes then get an error back and it wants me to send it in
used to play WOW loved it but not tried it since ubuntu; anyway whats the error message
Well I'll let you knowp when i get it, I forgot to do opengl now though so it's talking about that.. just sitting there
What's that one site I can past code to and send you the link, do you know?
use this to get to the forums
wow has gold support it should work nicely

Well it doesn't and it makes me sad. I'm sure it can, but there's some setting or something I gotta change, because it worked great back in 7.04 with the old Wine, better than in Windows, higher FPS and everything, with higher settings
